Package mangan

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DeploymentStrategy
    Strategy pattern interface for deployment strategies.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Coordinates
    Own class created to handle all the information of every single robot.
    DeployAngularSpiral
    Deploys an amount of robots following an angular spiral pattern, the robots are equally distributed over the length of the complete spiral
    DeployBadCenters
    Deploys an amount of robots throwing two gaussian distributions randomly spread on the map, but forcing the center of the gaussian functions to be quite distant, so we can test the behavior of the robots in two irregular groups.
    DeployCircle
    Deploys an amount of robots following a circle pattern where every robots keeps the distance with the inner and outer layer or perimeter as well as the other robots in its layer.
    DeployGauss
    Deploys an amount of robots in random positions following a Gaussian distribution , using a predefined Mean and Variance
    DeploymentContext
    Strategy pattern pseudo class.
    DeployRandom
    Deploys an amount of robots in random positions within the given sea limits.
    DeploySpiral
    Deploys an amount of robots following a archimedean spiral pattern with 4 circles.
    DeploySquare
    Deploys an amount of robots following a filled squared pattern.
    Result
    Class for saving an comparing the results, especially for batch mode.
    Robot
    Implements the full logic of each robot.
    Simulator
    Main class coordinating the evolution of the steps taken by the robots while interacting with them in order to provide the data they are allowed to know by the requirements, in the way they are supposed to.
    Visualisation
    The main Visualization which is based on Processing (http://www.processing.org/) for the main animation part and based on a Processing library called ControlP5 (http://www.sojamo.de/libraries/controlP5/) for the menu part.
    VisualRobot
    This class represents every robot object visualized through Processing.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    RobotHasNoNeighborException
    Exception thrown in case of, having already a robot in the surface, a deployment is attempted in a position where the robots would not be able to see each other
